â€¢ Management of apparent prolonged latent phase
o Exclude other causes of abdominal pain, e.g. abruptio placentae, urinary tract infection.
o Consider false labour, characterised by no cervical changes and no increase in duration, regularity
or frequency of labour pains. Women with false labour may be discharged home if there are no other
obstetric problems.
o If certain that the woman has a prolonged latent phase, exclude fetal distress and CPD,
